head.title: Mets' Farm Club Gets TV Contract

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

hedline.hl1: Mets' Farm Club Gets TV Contract

abstract.p: Fox Sports New York will televise 10 Brooklyn Cyclones games (S)

block.p: The Brooklyn Cyclones, who had a phenomenally successful first season last year playing in Coney Island, will have 10 games televised this season on Fox Sports New York. The games will be called by Curt Menefee, the co-anchor of the MSG Network's revamped ''SportsDesk.''

Last year, 10 games were shown on the Metro Channel, which, like FSNY, is owned by Cablevision. Moving to FSNY, which is available to seven million cable homes in the market, expands Cyclones games to an audience beyond New York City. Most of the games will be rebroadcast on MSG.

The Brooklyn Cyclones, who had a phenomenally successful first season last year playing in Coney Island, will have 10 games televised this season on Fox Sports New York. The games will be called by Curt Menefee, the co-anchor of the MSG Network's revamped ''SportsDesk.''

Last year, 10 games were shown on the Metro Channel, which, like FSNY, is owned by Cablevision. Moving to FSNY, which is available to seven million cable homes in the market, expands Cyclones games to an audience beyond New York City. Most of the games will be rebroadcast on MSG.
The Cyclones are the Mets' Class A affiliate in the New York-Penn League.
